meanings.definition: To make or become rough or harsh in texture or tone.
meanings.sent1: Rubbing the sandpaper against the wood coarsens its surface.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to the sun and wind coarsens the fabric over time.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his sense of humor coarsens with each bad pun.
meanings.sent4: The anger in his voice coarsens the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing against the rocks coarsens the peaceful beach scene.

meanings.definition: To make or become less refined or cultured.
meanings.sent1: Watching violent movies coarsens the mind and desensitizes emotions.
meanings.sent2: The lack of manners and etiquette coarsens the social interactions in the community.
meanings.sent3: The fancy restaurant decided to serve fast food to coarsen the dining experience.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to negativity coarsens the soul and diminishes empathy.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the historic building coarsens the elegance of the architecture.
